website_summaries.verdict: iDevices' Kitchen Thermometer Mini is a solid thermometer that delivers smart functionality and hands-free convenience at an entry-level price.
pros: The $40 iDevices Kitchen Thermometer Mini uses Bluetooth tech to send real-time status updates straight to your phone
cons: You'll need to read the manual to make sense of the thermometer's LED indicator lights
It's powered by a CR2032 coin battery, which isn't exactly a household staple

customer_reviews.title: Works great...with Weber Grill app
customer_reviews.text: This is very affordable and works great, but I couldn't get it to link to my iDevices app. Instead, I downloaded and installed the Weber iGrill app, which it worked fine with.

customer_reviews.title: this is one of the worst thermometer's I've used

I didn't wash it in the dishwasher or anything, I just rinsed it after use. I bought an instant read one that doesn't stay in during cooking and i'm much happier.

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Cool

Im glad I got it, and he is too!

customer_reviews.title: Newest App May Not Work, but there are Solutions. Read On.
customer_reviews.text: I just bought this probe, and haven't had a chance to use it. I've been fighting with the App that runs it for the last few days. It refused to connect to any of my devices using the latest iGrill app from Weber. After contacting the manufacturer, who told me their devs are looking into it but couldn't provide a solution, an internet search turned up that this device worked just fine with the previous version of the app. If you google "igrill APK 3.2.2" (without the quotes) you can find an older version that fired right up for me and the probe seems to be working great. Will update this after I get a chance to use the device.

customer_reviews.title: Just get a non-bluetooth digital thermometer
customer_reviews.text: Worked well for awhile, but it's hampered by being completely reliant on pairing with your device for several reasons: No on temperature readout on the actual thermometer If your device is muted the alarm will sometimes sound, and sometimes not After an update it no longer paired with my phone The LED light began to flicker after a few months It was a nice novelty for awhile, but ultimately it's going to make itself obsolete eventually as they don't seem to keep up with updates. Your money would be better invested in a digital thermometer that doesn't rely on additional technology.

customer_reviews.title: Versatile, simple-to-use remote kitchen thermometer
customer_reviews.text: The iDevices Mini Kitchen Thermometer came in very handy for me recently during our annual holiday party. When you are greeting guests and socializing, you don't want to have to be popping in and out of the kitchen to check on a dish in the oven, and this handy little gadget allowed me to monitor progress with quick glances at my phone. Setup is simple and straightforward, and I had no problems downloading and installing the app, or linking to the device. I especially like the chart-style readout which shows the temperature rise, which helps you anticipate when the alarm is going to go off.
customer_reviews.author: Gary K. McCormick

customer_reviews.title: Very accurate and Bluetooth integration works well
customer_reviews.text: Everyone should own a meat thermometer and avoid the otherwise inevitable guessing game that can ruin meat in the final steps of cooking. The question is, is it better to own a traditional analog thermometer or something digital? While most analog devices work just fine, the digital version is surprisingly more accurate and the fact that it can alert the phone when the meat is ready basically replaces the need for an oven timer completely. The app itself installs easily and it's simple enough even for non techies to understand. It's not a revolutionary leap in either cooking or technology but definitely a welcome gadget that's worth checking out.
customer_reviews.author: James Beswick

product_meta.title: iDevices Kitchen Thermometer, Mini
product_meta.description: This ultra-compact Bluetooth Smart thermometer will add incredible intelligence and convenience to your everyday cooking. Featuring a 150 foot Bluetooth Smart range, get back to what's most important to you with the comfort of knowing your food is being cooked to perfection. Using the free iDevices Connected app, select what you're cooking from the list of preset temperature alarms, or create a custom alarm. You'll receive an alert on your smart device once your food is ready to enjoy. With magnetic mounting and dual positioning, you can conveniently place your Kitchen Thermometer mini anywhere in your kitchen for easy viewing. The free app features exclusive recipes, a kitchen timer, social sharing and more. Compatible with iOS devices running iOS7+ (iPhone 4S+, iPad mini, iPad 3+ and iPod touch 5+) and most Bluetooth Smart Ready Android devices running 4.3+. Start cooking with Confidence.
feature_bullets: The Kitchen mini thermometer measures temperatures between -22° F (-30°C) to 572° F (300°C)
Temperature LED indicator with proximity wake-up shows progression from start to done without lifting the lid on your grill or smoker
